references.paper_title: Capturing and inferring dense full-body human-scene contact
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it focuses on dense human-scene contact estimation, a crucial aspect of 3D human-object interaction understanding that is directly addressed in the target paper.
This paper is important as it directly tackles the problem of detecting human-object contact in 2D images, which is a foundational element that the target paper extends to 3D egocentric settings.

references.paper_title: 3d affordancenet: A benchmark for visual object affordance understanding
references.reason: This work is highly relevant as it introduces a benchmark dataset and task for 3D affordance understanding, which is directly used to support the task and evaluation in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Ego-topo: Environment affordances from egocentric video
references.reason: This paper is important because it explores the perception of environment affordances from the egocentric perspective, a core challenge that is directly addressed and expanded upon in the target paper.

references.paper_title: DECO: Dense estimation of 3d human-scene contact in the wild
references.reason: This paper provides a direct comparison method for dense 3D human-scene contact estimation, which is a closely related task to the 3D human-object interaction regions estimation presented in the target paper.
